results.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 6229
results.contentSummary: Pauline epistles, et al.
results.marginalsSummary: a few cases of correction and more numerous quotation markers, otherwise rather rich amount of reading cues that indicate liturgical occasion, "usque hic", "finit" and crosses that also indicate the beginnings of readings, also some running titles

results.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 6233
results.contentSummary: Expositio in evangelium Matthei; Homiliae
results.marginalsSummary: some int. and mg. corrections, and a few singposts, a single attachment

results.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 6243
results.contentSummary: Collectio canonum Freisingensis
results.marginalsSummary: some corrections and signposts, numerous reading cues

results.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 6246 (2v-31v)
results.contentSummary: Dionysio-Hadriana; De septem gradibus ecclesiae; et al.
results.marginalsSummary: all in all some eight mg. corrections

results.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 6298
results.contentSummary: Caesarius of Arles, Homiliae
results.marginalsSummary: numerous corrections and attachments (probations, including drawing) and a single annotation

results.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 6307
results.contentSummary: Isidore, In libros regum; Origen, In Cantica canticorum; Bede, In librum Tobiae
results.marginalsSummary: numerous signposts, few corrections and interlineal annotations, and a single attachment

results.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 6316
results.contentSummary: Gregory the Great, Homilae in Ezechihelem
results.marginalsSummary: numerous signposts, corrections and section numbers

results.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 6343
results.contentSummary: John Cassian, Collationes
results.marginalsSummary: numerous quotation markers, some corrections, signposts and attachments

results.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 6382 (1r-43v)
results.contentSummary: Vita sanctae Eufrosinae; excerpts (Isidore, Gregory the Great, Augustine et al.)
results.marginalsSummary: numerous catchphrases, a few signposts and a single attachment and annotation

results.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 6382 (44r-172v)
results.contentSummary: Gregory the Great, Moralia in Iob; et al.
results.marginalsSummary: a few corrections and a probation

results.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 6402
results.contentSummary: Juvencus, Historia evangelica
results.marginalsSummary: Numerous int. and mg. annotations as well as corrections, some probations, signposts and a few attachments

results.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 6433
results.contentSummary: Isidore, Sententiae; Isidore, Synonyma; Praedicatio ad populum satis necessarium; et al.
results.marginalsSummary: some signposts, a single correction and a possible probation

results.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 14080
results.contentSummary: Isaias; Hieremias; et al.
results.marginalsSummary: Numerous reading cues, corrections and signposts, a few annotations and a single attachment

results.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 14096 (1r-101v)
results.contentSummary: Isidore, Prooemia in libros veteris ac novi testamenti; Isidore, Vita vel obitus sanctorum; exegetical text; excerpt collection
results.marginalsSummary: some corrections and a single reference

results.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 14197
results.contentSummary: Ezechiel; Daniel; XII prophetae minores
results.marginalsSummary: Abundant reading cues, numerous signposts and some corrections, a few catchphrases and annotations

results.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 14325
results.contentSummary: Isidore, Sententiae; exegetical text; John Chrysostom, Homiliae; et al.
results.marginalsSummary: A single annotation and signpost, a few corrections and a number of running titles

results.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 18092
results.contentSummary: Alan of Farfa, Homiliae
results.marginalsSummary: primarily numerous int. and mg. corrections and a number of attachments in mg.and signposts, a few annotations

results.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 29270/5 + New York, Pierpont Morgan Library, Ms. G.26 + Stuttgart, Württembergische Landesbibliothek, Cod. Fragm. 64 + Inc. 2o 9600 (fragm., Abdr.) + Wien, Österreichische Nationalbibliothek, Ms. Lat. Ser. Nov. 3201 + Würzburg, Universitätsbibliothek, M.p.th.f. 190 ; Inc. I.t.f. 516 ; Inc. I.t.f. 952 (Abdr.)
results.contentSummary: Evangelia
results.marginalsSummary: some reading cues and a probation

results.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 6253
results.contentSummary: Cassidorus, Expositio Psalmorum, I-L
results.marginalsSummary: numerous Cassiodorian signposts throughout; numerous marg. and int. annotations, corrections and signposts (nota signs), some attachments and other signposts

results.name: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, VLF 48 (1r-95v)
results.contentSummary: Martianus Capella + oldest commentary tradition
results.marginalsSummary: oldest commentary tradition + individual annotations + hand of Rather of Verona highlighting remarkable words

results.name: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, VLF 113 (1-70)
results.contentSummary: Part I of a codex which contains two units; all with a content in the area of geography, history.
results.marginalsSummary: few marginalia, mainly corrections

results.name: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, VLF 113 (71-90)
results.contentSummary: Part II of a codex which contains two units; the content is a miscellany of geography, history, theology.
results.marginalsSummary: few marginalia, mainly corrections

results.name: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, VLQ 38 (1r-153v)
results.contentSummary: All six comedies of Terence, with beautiful coloured illustrations.
results.marginalsSummary: The manuscript is not heavily glossed, but it has some interlinear annotations (grammar/vocabulary) and fewer marginal ones. The margin is also used for speaker notifications, and signs such as nota-signs, correction signs. Space in between the plays is mostly used for illustrations, but sometimes for commentary text.

results.name: Vatican City, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana, Pal. lat. 24 (1r-177v)
results.contentSummary: Biblia, Libri sapientiales et didactici
results.marginalsSummary: very small amount of marginalia. only corrections, small additions.

results.name: Vatican City, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana, Pal. lat 68 (1r-46v)
results.contentSummary: Glossa in Psalmos. Glosses of the psalms, as a separate main text. Word- and sentence explanations for Psalm 39 (on David), 11-151 (the beginning is missing). Based on commentary of Jerome, Theodorus Mopsuestia, and others and ends with the apocryphal psalm 151.
results.marginalsSummary: some additions in a carolingian minuscule and 25 Old Irish and 5 Old English glosses. many crosses and quotation marks, some authority references. every page is filled with signs.

results.name: Vatican City, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana, Pal. lat 187 (1r-66v)
results.contentSummary: an Old Latin Psalter with a letter and a prologue of Jerome; ps-Galen, Alfabetum ad Paternum
results.marginalsSummary: a cross symbol on f. 32v, 38v, and more ff. at new lemma's someone thought important. On f. 1r some ex libri and content titles.

results.name: Heidelberg, Universitätsbibliothek, Cod. Pal. lat 864 (1r-134v)
results.contentSummary: Gregory of Tours, Ecclasiastical History of the Francs, rewritten/extended by Fredegarius, and three liturgical verses
results.marginalsSummary:
The margins are mostly empty, apart from reading cues on almost every page.
Further: corrections and some marginal annotations and additions to the text, and two added small leafs. Some correction signs in the margin ('r' for requisitum est), some quotation signs. 
Later layer of annotations: on f. 134v three liturgical verses and early German neums. Neums also on f. 3r. Occasional reference note to texts added on separate pieces of parchment.

results.name: Karlsruhe, Badische Hof- und Landesbibliothek, Aug. perg. 105 (1r-234v)
results.contentSummary: Jerome, Letters
results.marginalsSummary: Large amount of marginal annotations and symbols in several layers, dispersed over several centuries. In the oldest layer: corrections in text and margins, annotations with reference marks, nota signs, quotation marks, and other symbols such as dots, crosses, asterisks. Chapter numbering in the margin (extra column) and references to other authors.

results.name: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, VLF4 (1-3)
results.contentSummary: Homilies (redacted by Paul the Deacon for Charlemagne), Pliny's Natural History II.196-III.65
results.marginalsSummary: Hardly any marginalia: just a few numbers, here and there some probations by later hands.

results.name: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, VLF 4 (4-33)
results.contentSummary: Pliny, Natural history, II.196-III.65
results.marginalsSummary: In this manuscript marginal annotations have been added: keywords of summaries, lacunae, hic signs, some corrections. This was done in a hand contemporary to that of the copyists. Some glosses are vertically organized, some are shaped into a circular or egg-form.

results.name: Vatican City, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana, Pal. lat. 170 (1r-84v) + Darmstadt, Universitäts- und Landesbibliotek, Hs. 3316
results.contentSummary: Hegesippus qui dicitur, Historical Chronicle of Hegesippus in five books.
results.marginalsSummary: very few annotations. some corrections, a few nota signs, crosses and r's (requisitum est), and 'hd's ('hic de est', typical Lorsch-reference sign)

results.name: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, VLF 6 (1-264)
results.contentSummary: Augustine, De civitate dei; a huge and heavy book with lots of text written in relatively small letters (one column) on large pages.
results.marginalsSummary: In the margin we see primarily annotations to bring structure to the text (chapter numbers, indexing glosses). Numerous nota-signs, quatation marks, some corrections and lacunae, but very little evidence of explanation, interpretation or commentary. So: annotated on 80% of its pages, but only lightly.

results.name: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, VLF 17 (1-164)
results.contentSummary: A tenth century manuscript with two codicological units: Flavius Josephus (Antiquitates iudaicae, f. 1-164) and Hegesippus (Historia, f. 165-214).
results.marginalsSummary: In the first ca 70 pages, one or a few annotations are found per page/couple of pages. They are shaped to a tapered form. On later pages, many symbolic annotation signs are found, including P's in all sorts of shapes.

results.name: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, VLF 17 (165-214)
results.contentSummary: Second part of a tenth century codex containing two codicological units: 1. Flavius Josephus, Antiquitates iudaicae (f. 1r-164v); 2. Hegesippus, Historia (f. 165-214)
results.marginalsSummary: Very few annotations, a few crosses.

results.name: Vatican City, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana, Pal. lat. 189 (1r-129v)
results.contentSummary: Augustinus, De doctrina Christiana
results.marginalsSummary: almost no marginal activity, empty margins. most marginalia in first quarter of the MS

results.name: Vatican City, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana, Pal. lat. 188 (Ir-1r-81v)
results.contentSummary: Augustinus, De doctrina Christiana
results.marginalsSummary: numerous nota-signs in this MS, an added marginal index, neums and some corrections, annotations and trigons.

results.name: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, VLF 24 (1-111)
results.contentSummary: Collection of glossaries, made in Eastern Gaul (Bischoff, Südost-deutschen Schreibschulen, 233)
results.marginalsSummary: Overall, the manuscript is not heavily annotated, but it definitely has signs of usage. The etymological letters (G for Greek, H or HB for Hebrew) are most frequent. They are mostly carried out by the text hand. Few annotations, and they are mostly in one of the later text units in the codex. Multiple hands in the text and in the margins.

results.name: Vatican City, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana, Pal. lat. 177 (1r-123v)
results.contentSummary: Jerome, Commentary to Mattheus.
results.marginalsSummary: marginal activity consists of symbols that draw attention to a certain word or group of words, reading cues and quotation signs.

results.name: Vatican City, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana, Pal. lat. 560 (Ar-110v)
results.contentSummary: Iohannes Cassianus, a collection of 'Collationes'
results.marginalsSummary: quotation marks and added index, some additions marked 'hd' where the text is missing.

results.name: Vatican City, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana, Pal. lat. 822 (1r-175v)
results.contentSummary: Rufinus Aquileiensis - translation and continuation of the 'Historia Ecclesiastica' of Eusebius of Caesarea

results.name: Vatican City, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana, Pal. lat. 554 (1r-4v)
results.contentSummary: Fragments of penitential texts: Discipulus umbriensium, exerpts of different pentitential texts and a small piece of 'De tribus infelicibus'. Part of a later compilated MS. 5r-13v contains the 'penitentiale Egberti' (see Pal. lat. 554 - Fasz. II)
results.marginalsSummary: almost nothing. f. 1r contains the old shelfmarks, a later hand wrote two short sentences on f. 1v, of which one; 'hieronimus de penitentia h...', and on f. 4v three loose words: 'Medici', 'profalute' and 'animarum'.

results.name: Vatican City, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana, Pal. lat. 554 (5r-13r)
results.contentSummary: Penitences of Egbert, Archbishop of York, with added passages of Cummean and Bede.
results.marginalsSummary: very small amount of marginal activity. Someone has been correcting some sentences and marked some words in a Carolingian minuscule.

results.name: Vatican City, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana, Pal. lat. 829 (1r-115v)
results.contentSummary:
Orosius - Historiae adversum paganos 
Sulpicius Severus - Epistulae

results.name: Vatican City, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana, Pal. lat. 195 (1r-106v +1)
results.contentSummary:
Anonymus - Questiones sive capitula librorum
Augustine - de consensu evangelistarum, book I-IV
results.marginalsSummary: small amount of marginal activity, only some annotations that are additions to the text, corrections and some signposts.

results.name: Bad Homburg, Verwaltung der Staatlichen Schlösser und Gärten Hessen, Inv.-Nr. 6.1.580. (1r-2v)
results.contentSummary: Biblia, Liber Tobiae
results.marginalsSummary: substantial number of crosses and reading cues.

results.name: Bamberg, Staatsbibliothek, Msc. Med. 1 (1r-75v)
results.contentSummary: composition of different medical works about medication

results.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 29265/4 (1r-1v)
results.contentSummary: Biblia - Proverbia Salomonis (Proverbs of Solomon/Books of Proverbs)
results.marginalsSummary: almost none. A 'P' in the 'recto'-margin, and the 'B' in the 'verso'-margin, almost no corrections.

results.contentSummary:
Pelagius, Libellus fidei
'Ephraem Latinus', Sermones 
Beda, Vita Cuthberti 
Isidore, Synonyma

liber historiae francorum - The history of the Franks by Gregory of Tours

refs.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 6229
refs.contentSummary: Pauline epistles, et al.
refs.marginalsSummary: a few cases of correction and more numerous quotation markers, otherwise rather rich amount of reading cues that indicate liturgical occasion, "usque hic", "finit" and crosses that also indicate the beginnings of readings, also some running titles

refs.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 6233
refs.contentSummary: Expositio in evangelium Matthei; Homiliae
refs.marginalsSummary: some int. and mg. corrections, and a few singposts, a single attachment

refs.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 6243
refs.contentSummary: Collectio canonum Freisingensis
refs.marginalsSummary: some corrections and signposts, numerous reading cues

refs.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 6246 (2v-31v)
refs.contentSummary: Dionysio-Hadriana; De septem gradibus ecclesiae; et al.
refs.marginalsSummary: all in all some eight mg. corrections

refs.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 6298
refs.contentSummary: Caesarius of Arles, Homiliae
refs.marginalsSummary: numerous corrections and attachments (probations, including drawing) and a single annotation

refs.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 6307
refs.contentSummary: Isidore, In libros regum; Origen, In Cantica canticorum; Bede, In librum Tobiae
refs.marginalsSummary: numerous signposts, few corrections and interlineal annotations, and a single attachment

refs.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 6316
refs.contentSummary: Gregory the Great, Homilae in Ezechihelem
refs.marginalsSummary: numerous signposts, corrections and section numbers

refs.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 6343
refs.contentSummary: John Cassian, Collationes
refs.marginalsSummary: numerous quotation markers, some corrections, signposts and attachments

refs.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 6382 (1r-43v)
refs.contentSummary: Vita sanctae Eufrosinae; excerpts (Isidore, Gregory the Great, Augustine et al.)
refs.marginalsSummary: numerous catchphrases, a few signposts and a single attachment and annotation

refs.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 6382 (44r-172v)
refs.contentSummary: Gregory the Great, Moralia in Iob; et al.
refs.marginalsSummary: a few corrections and a probation

refs.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 6402
refs.contentSummary: Juvencus, Historia evangelica
refs.marginalsSummary: Numerous int. and mg. annotations as well as corrections, some probations, signposts and a few attachments

refs.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 6433
refs.contentSummary: Isidore, Sententiae; Isidore, Synonyma; Praedicatio ad populum satis necessarium; et al.
refs.marginalsSummary: some signposts, a single correction and a possible probation

refs.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 14080
refs.contentSummary: Isaias; Hieremias; et al.
refs.marginalsSummary: Numerous reading cues, corrections and signposts, a few annotations and a single attachment

refs.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 14096 (1r-101v)
refs.contentSummary: Isidore, Prooemia in libros veteris ac novi testamenti; Isidore, Vita vel obitus sanctorum; exegetical text; excerpt collection
refs.marginalsSummary: some corrections and a single reference

refs.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 14197
refs.contentSummary: Ezechiel; Daniel; XII prophetae minores
refs.marginalsSummary: Abundant reading cues, numerous signposts and some corrections, a few catchphrases and annotations

refs.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 14325
refs.contentSummary: Isidore, Sententiae; exegetical text; John Chrysostom, Homiliae; et al.
refs.marginalsSummary: A single annotation and signpost, a few corrections and a number of running titles

refs.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 18092
refs.contentSummary: Alan of Farfa, Homiliae
refs.marginalsSummary: primarily numerous int. and mg. corrections and a number of attachments in mg.and signposts, a few annotations

refs.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 29270/5 + New York, Pierpont Morgan Library, Ms. G.26 + Stuttgart, Württembergische Landesbibliothek, Cod. Fragm. 64 + Inc. 2o 9600 (fragm., Abdr.) + Wien, Österreichische Nationalbibliothek, Ms. Lat. Ser. Nov. 3201 + Würzburg, Universitätsbibliothek, M.p.th.f. 190 ; Inc. I.t.f. 516 ; Inc. I.t.f. 952 (Abdr.)
refs.contentSummary: Evangelia
refs.marginalsSummary: some reading cues and a probation

refs.name: München, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek, Clm 6253
refs.contentSummary: Cassidorus, Expositio Psalmorum, I-L
refs.marginalsSummary: numerous Cassiodorian signposts throughout; numerous marg. and int. annotations, corrections and signposts (nota signs), some attachments and other signposts

refs.name: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, VLF 48 (1r-95v)
refs.contentSummary: Martianus Capella + oldest commentary tradition
refs.marginalsSummary: oldest commentary tradition + individual annotations + hand of Rather of Verona highlighting remarkable words

refs.name: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, VLF 113 (1-70)
refs.contentSummary: Part I of a codex which contains two units; all with a content in the area of geography, history.
refs.marginalsSummary: few marginalia, mainly corrections

refs.name: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, VLF 113 (71-90)
refs.contentSummary: Part II of a codex which contains two units; the content is a miscellany of geography, history, theology.
refs.marginalsSummary: few marginalia, mainly corrections

refs.name: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, VLQ 38 (1r-153v)
refs.contentSummary: All six comedies of Terence, with beautiful coloured illustrations.
refs.marginalsSummary: The manuscript is not heavily glossed, but it has some interlinear annotations (grammar/vocabulary) and fewer marginal ones. The margin is also used for speaker notifications, and signs such as nota-signs, correction signs. Space in between the plays is mostly used for illustrations, but sometimes for commentary text.

refs.name: Vatican City, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana, Pal. lat. 24 (1r-177v)
refs.contentSummary: Biblia, Libri sapientiales et didactici
refs.marginalsSummary: very small amount of marginalia. only corrections, small additions.

refs.name: Vatican City, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana, Pal. lat 68 (1r-46v)
refs.contentSummary: Glossa in Psalmos. Glosses of the psalms, as a separate main text. Word- and sentence explanations for Psalm 39 (on David), 11-151 (the beginning is missing). Based on commentary of Jerome, Theodorus Mopsuestia, and others and ends with the apocryphal psalm 151.
refs.marginalsSummary: some additions in a carolingian minuscule and 25 Old Irish and 5 Old English glosses. many crosses and quotation marks, some authority references. every page is filled with signs.

refs.name: Vatican City, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana, Pal. lat 187 (1r-66v)
refs.contentSummary: an Old Latin Psalter with a letter and a prologue of Jerome; ps-Galen, Alfabetum ad Paternum
refs.marginalsSummary: a cross symbol on f. 32v, 38v, and more ff. at new lemma's someone thought important. On f. 1r some ex libri and content titles.

refs.name: Heidelberg, Universitätsbibliothek, Cod. Pal. lat 864 (1r-134v)
refs.contentSummary: Gregory of Tours, Ecclasiastical History of the Francs, rewritten/extended by Fredegarius, and three liturgical verses
refs.marginalsSummary:
The margins are mostly empty, apart from reading cues on almost every page.
Further: corrections and some marginal annotations and additions to the text, and two added small leafs. Some correction signs in the margin ('r' for requisitum est), some quotation signs. 
Later layer of annotations: on f. 134v three liturgical verses and early German neums. Neums also on f. 3r. Occasional reference note to texts added on separate pieces of parchment.

refs.name: Karlsruhe, Badische Hof- und Landesbibliothek, Aug. perg. 105 (1r-234v)
refs.contentSummary: Jerome, Letters
refs.marginalsSummary: Large amount of marginal annotations and symbols in several layers, dispersed over several centuries. In the oldest layer: corrections in text and margins, annotations with reference marks, nota signs, quotation marks, and other symbols such as dots, crosses, asterisks. Chapter numbering in the margin (extra column) and references to other authors.

refs.name: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, VLF4 (1-3)
refs.contentSummary: Homilies (redacted by Paul the Deacon for Charlemagne), Pliny's Natural History II.196-III.65
refs.marginalsSummary: Hardly any marginalia: just a few numbers, here and there some probations by later hands.

refs.name: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, VLF 4 (4-33)
refs.contentSummary: Pliny, Natural history, II.196-III.65
refs.marginalsSummary: In this manuscript marginal annotations have been added: keywords of summaries, lacunae, hic signs, some corrections. This was done in a hand contemporary to that of the copyists. Some glosses are vertically organized, some are shaped into a circular or egg-form.

refs.name: Vatican City, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana, Pal. lat. 170 (1r-84v) + Darmstadt, Universitäts- und Landesbibliotek, Hs. 3316
refs.contentSummary: Hegesippus qui dicitur, Historical Chronicle of Hegesippus in five books.
refs.marginalsSummary: very few annotations. some corrections, a few nota signs, crosses and r's (requisitum est), and 'hd's ('hic de est', typical Lorsch-reference sign)

refs.name: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, VLF 6 (1-264)
refs.contentSummary: Augustine, De civitate dei; a huge and heavy book with lots of text written in relatively small letters (one column) on large pages.
refs.marginalsSummary: In the margin we see primarily annotations to bring structure to the text (chapter numbers, indexing glosses). Numerous nota-signs, quatation marks, some corrections and lacunae, but very little evidence of explanation, interpretation or commentary. So: annotated on 80% of its pages, but only lightly.

refs.name: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, VLF 17 (1-164)
refs.contentSummary: A tenth century manuscript with two codicological units: Flavius Josephus (Antiquitates iudaicae, f. 1-164) and Hegesippus (Historia, f. 165-214).
refs.marginalsSummary: In the first ca 70 pages, one or a few annotations are found per page/couple of pages. They are shaped to a tapered form. On later pages, many symbolic annotation signs are found, including P's in all sorts of shapes.

refs.name: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, VLF 17 (165-214)
refs.contentSummary: Second part of a tenth century codex containing two codicological units: 1. Flavius Josephus, Antiquitates iudaicae (f. 1r-164v); 2. Hegesippus, Historia (f. 165-214)
refs.marginalsSummary: Very few annotations, a few crosses.

refs.name: Vatican City, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana, Pal. lat. 189 (1r-129v)
refs.contentSummary: Augustinus, De doctrina Christiana
refs.marginalsSummary: almost no marginal activity, empty margins. most marginalia in first quarter of the MS

refs.name: Vatican City, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana, Pal. lat. 188 (Ir-1r-81v)
refs.contentSummary: Augustinus, De doctrina Christiana
refs.marginalsSummary: numerous nota-signs in this MS, an added marginal index, neums and some corrections, annotations and trigons.

refs.name: Leiden, Universiteitsbibliotheek, VLF 24 (1-111)
refs.contentSummary: Collection of glossaries, made in Eastern Gaul (Bischoff, Südost-deutschen Schreibschulen, 233)
refs.marginalsSummary: Overall, the manuscript is not heavily annotated, but it definitely has signs of usage. The etymological letters (G for Greek, H or HB for Hebrew) are most frequent. They are mostly carried out by the text hand. Few annotations, and they are mostly in one of the later text units in the codex. Multiple hands in the text and in the margins.

refs.name: Vatican City, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana, Pal. lat. 177 (1r-123v)
refs.contentSummary: Jerome, Commentary to Mattheus.
refs.marginalsSummary: marginal activity consists of symbols that draw attention to a certain word or group of words, reading cues and quotation signs.

refs.name: Vatican City, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana, Pal. lat. 560 (Ar-110v)
refs.contentSummary: Iohannes Cassianus, a collection of 'Collationes'
refs.marginalsSummary: quotation marks and added index, some additions marked 'hd' where the text is missing.

refs.name: Vatican City, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana, Pal. lat. 822 (1r-175v)
refs.contentSummary: Rufinus Aquileiensis - translation and continuation of the 'Historia Ecclesiastica' of Eusebius of Caesarea

refs.name: Vatican City, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana, Pal. lat. 554 (1r-4v)
refs.contentSummary: Fragments of penitential texts: Discipulus umbriensium, exerpts of different pentitential texts and a small piece of 'De tribus infelicibus'. Part of a later compilated MS. 5r-13v contains the 'penitentiale Egberti' (see Pal. lat. 554 - Fasz. II)
refs.marginalsSummary: almost nothing. f. 1r contains the old shelfmarks, a later hand wrote two short sentences on f. 1v, of which one; 'hieronimus de penitentia h...', and on f. 4v three loose words: 'Medici', 'profalute' and 'animarum'.

refs.name: Vatican City, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana, Pal. lat. 554 (5r-13r)
refs.contentSummary: Penitences of Egbert, Archbishop of York, with added passages of Cummean and Bede.
refs.marginalsSummary: very small amount of marginal activity. Someone has been correcting some sentences and marked some words in a Carolingian minuscule.

refs.name: Vatican City, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana, Pal. lat. 829 (1r-115v)
refs.contentSummary:
Orosius - Historiae adversum paganos 
Sulpicius Severus - Epistulae

refs.name: Vatican City, Bibliotheca Apostolica Vaticana, Pal. lat. 195 (1r-106v +1)
refs.contentSummary:
Anonymus - Questiones sive capitula librorum
Augustine - de consensu evangelistarum, book I-IV
refs.marginalsSummary: small amount of marginal activity, only some annotations that are additions to the text, corrections and some signposts.

refs.contentSummary: Biblia, Liber Tobiae
refs.marginalsSummary: substantial number of crosses and reading cues.

refs.contentSummary: composition of different medical works about medication

refs.contentSummary:
Pelagius, Libellus fidei
'Ephraem Latinus', Sermones

liber historiae francorum - The history of the Franks by Gregory of Tours
